oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Resolutions adopted by Missouri regarding slavery
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Series of resolutions adopted by the general assembly of Missouri. The preamble to the resolutions states that the southern and southwestern states will resist interference to their slave laws peacefully if they can and forcibly if they must. A copy of the resolutions was sent to the governor of each state in the Union and each member of Congress.

The Missouri Compromise of 1820 was a federal statue that regulated slavery in the newly-formed western states north of the parallel 36' 30' north. The Compromise was supported by both pro-slavery and anti-slavery parties.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: General Assembly of the State of Missouri
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Missouri compromise; Slavery;
